pullrequest.title: Helper classes for computing Signal Statistics

content.raw:
An enum is more performant than using a string, but I figured it will be easier to add new statistics without breaking API by using strings instead of enums.

I don't know if that's a worthwhile trade-off, but it was my rationale for using strings.

Regarding performance, I figured that the common use case for this class is that a loop will call `InsertData` many times, and then afterwards `GetMap` will be called once. The strings are not used at all during `InsertData`, only afterwards in the single `GetMap` call. That's my rationale for that trade-off.

Should I add these comments to the document somewhere?

I don't know if that's a worthwhile trade-off, but it was my rationale for using strings.

Regarding performance, I figured that the common use case for this class is that a loop will call InsertData many times, and then afterwards GetMap will be called once. The strings are not used at all during InsertData, only afterwards in the single GetMap call. That's my rationale for that trade-off.
